description: From Middle English aspen, corresponding to asp +‎ -en.

adjectives.description: aspen (comparative more aspen, superlative most aspen)

entries.meaning: Pertaining to the asp or aspen tree.
(obsolete) Of a woman's tongue: wagging, gossiping.

description: From Middle English aspen, from Old English æspen, Old English æspan (combining form), from Old English æspe (“aspen”). More at asp.

entries.meaning: The asp tree; a kind of poplar tree (genus Populus sect. Populus). A medium-size tree with thin, straight trunks of a greenish-white color.
examples: Above a certain elevation, the aspens gave way to scrubby, gnarled pines.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The wood of such a tree; usually pale, lightweight and soft.
examples: She claimed that aspen was the only "proper" material from which make a wicker basket.
